instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S0SW_LCD: What is PP3V3_S0SW_LCD? PP3V3_S0SW_LCD is a 3.3v power rail necessary to power the image circuitry on the screen. This is necessary to get a picture on the screen. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> WITH NO VIDEO ON INTERNAL SCREEN
threads.message: Good day guys, I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with No image, but works fine on the external display. My <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> signals are not present, only pulse at the first few seconds, I have replaced the video cable as well as the video connector on the board, but no changes, I checked for a short but could not find any, please help me on where to go from here.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> WITH NO VIDEO ON INTERNAL SCREEN
threads.message:
Did you test with known good LCD assembly?
Check if <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> pulses at same time with 3V3/<SIGNAL>5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL>.
